sections.title: General Requirements
sections.summary: This section covers general provisions, definitions, and administrative requirements applicable to all building projects.

articles.title: Application of Code
articles.description: This code shall apply to the design, construction, alteration, and demolition of all buildings and structures within the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
requirements: All new construction must obtain a permit before commencement.
Alterations affecting structural stability require professional certification.
articles.notes: Exemptions may apply for minor repairs and temporary structures as defined by local authorities.

articles.title: Habitable Room Minimum Height
articles.description: Specifies the minimum ceiling height for rooms intended for human habitation to ensure comfort and adequate air circulation.
requirements: A minimum ceiling height of 2.7 meters is required for all habitable rooms.
For rooms with sloped ceilings, the average height must be at least 2.7 meters, with no portion less than 2.1 meters.

examples.application: The floor-to-ceiling measurement must be no less than 2.7m.
